column4: i'm having trouble with network manager. What should a route look like?
a declaration of gateway address for reaching certain network or host?
hehe wait... im putting mine on pastebin
hey guys. Help with network-manager. I seem to be having trouble with my route output whenver I use a certain IP
http://pastebin.com/m2eba9728 <==== this is the route output
when i use a 192.168.10.50, the route goes crazy, I can ping internally, but can't get out of the network. But when I use a 192.168.10.60, everything seems to be fine.
I didnt have this problem last week. and I need my ip to be 10.50 since i've already setup my NAT, etc.
any suggestions?
what do you mean by "when I use 192.168.10.50". These are two different machines?
the problem with the .50 is that the default route points to localhost instead of 192.168.10.2.
same machine. I just edited the IP in network manager.
That's right. My default gw should be 192.168.10.2 (that's our firewall).
aha. Hmm. I don't know why that would happen, though, but the gateway is wrong, maybe you can somehow force it correct.
oh wait, I said wrong way ... .60 is the one with localhost as gateway...
alankila, actually, it's the correct gateway. That's why I find it weird that when I set it to 10.60, it has a localhost gateway, but it can connect to the internet. but the one with 10.50 cannot

I agree. It is the first time I see something like this -- I have no idea how your symptoms can happen. Linux should not be capable of routing the packets correctly when it sets itself as the gateway.
yeah i know. it wasnt like this before, and i was wondering about it when i got here this mroning
ugh
can't even traceroute
check out if iptables nat and normal chains are empty when the localhost gateway is in use. Maybe there's some super weird netfilter setup
that's all I can think of
